headline: Okavango is exceptional but the premium requires justification
summary: The Okavango Delta offers unique water-based safari experiences unavailable elsewhere: mokoro rides, boat safaris, and wildlife along channels. However, it costs 2-3x more than East African alternatives. For first-time safari travelers, the premium may not be worth paying before experiencing more accessible destinations. For those seeking something genuinely different, it delivers.

assumptions.text: Okavango Delta camps cost 2-3x more than equivalent East African options.
The water-based safari experience is genuinely unique to the Okavango.
Wildlife density and variety is comparable to, not superior to, East Africa.

gains: Unique mokoro and boat safari experiences
Low tourist density and exclusive feeling
losses: Premium may not feel justified for first-timers

change_conditions: If water-based activities are specifically desired, Okavango is worth the premium.
If this is a first safari, East Africa may provide better value for the experience.
If budget allows and seeking exclusivity, Okavango delivers consistently.
If returning for a second or third safari, Okavango offers genuine novelty.
